page.title: 02LITTLE OAKLEY
page.content: LITTLE OAKLEY is a very small village. There are three farms,two are central. Also there is a wood called Sart Wood, it is dominated by deciduous trees, which lose their leaves in winter like the oak,ash,beech and hawthorn. A brook passes by LITTLE OAKLEY, it is called Harpers Brook. St. Peters Church is on the border of LITTLE OAKLEY.It is the property of the Orton Trust,an organisation that preserves architecture. Outside there is a sign saying "This building is maintained as a craft centre by the Orton Trust that restores Architecture." There are only a few amenities in LITTLE OAKLEY,a bus stop and the Church.A large amount of the buildings are cottages.Most of the land cover is sown pasture and farmland.
